title: Discussion-Centered Mobile Microlearning for Case-Based Science Problem Solving

context.prior_knowledge: Basic scientific knowledge (biology, chemistry, physics, etc.) and experience in problem analysis
context.additional_context: Asynchronous Mobile Discussions & Multidimensional Analysis of Complex Scientific Cases

learning_goals: Learners can identify over 80% of key problem elements by analyzing real-world scientific cases.
Through peer feedback and facilitator guidance during discussions, learners can expand the problem space (coverage) by over 50%.
Students can demonstrate the practical applicability of science problem-solving approaches by producing project deliverables.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
